resources.string: This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.

Developers:
 K. Sai Tanya
 R. Meghana
 Electronics and Computer Engineering
 Sreenidhi Institute of Science and Technology
 Welcome to our application - Agro Aid.
 Are you a farmer or a gardening enthusiast? Do you generally face issue with disease/pest attack and nutrient deficiency for your plant? Over time, the severity of these problems has increased and resulted in losses of crop and plants. 
According to a study by the Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India, the annual crop losses amount to Rs.50,000 crore($500 billion) due to disease attack, pest attack and nutrient deficiency.


"Concerted efforts are needed to forge an R and D-led strategy to save the loss of crops due to pests, weeds and diseases." 
-Hukmdev Narayan Yadav 
Chairman, Standing Committee of parliament on Agriculture and Farmers Welfare in 2016. 

In the vision for digital India, the government is looking for digital solutions enabling identification of disease attacks, pest attacks and nutrient deficiency and take appropriate steps in real time. Taking the inspiration, our project goal is to develop a simple application for phones that can identify crop diseases, pest damages and nutrient deficiency symptoms by analyzing the pictures taken by the user. So lets this started with the app. 
This is the Home page with 6 options. 
-> Identify Nutrient Deficiency. 
Choose this option if you want to identify any nutrient deficiency in plant. 
-> Identify Disease attack 
Choose this option if you want to identify any disease attack in plant. 
-> Identify Pest attack 
Choose this option if you want to identify any pest attack in plant 
-> Guide 
Choose this option if you want information on weather conditions, tools, how to plant and nutrition chart. 
-> Read about the application 
Choose this option if you want to read this tutorial. 
 -> Contact Experts. 
Choose this option if you want to contact experts for any advice or discussion. 

Exit the tutorial by clicking the (x) to continue with the application. 
Have a great day.
